intro: Erigeron paucilobus, commonly known as the few-lobed blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-blue leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Erigeron paucilobus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
